definition: cut off the flesh as punishment
lopsided/Taiwan pr. [kuai1]
surname Guo
"knife" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 18)/see also 立刀旁[li4 dao1 pang2]/see also 側刀旁|侧刀旁[ce4 dao1 pang2]
to make mincemeat of sb/to hack sb to pieces (used while cursing)
one who does not fear the death of thousand cuts will dare to unhorse the emperor (proverb)/to a fearless person, no fence is high enough
pinyin: she3 de5 yi1 shen1 gua3 , gan3 ba3 huang2 di4 la1 xia4 ma3
containing_words.word: 舍得一身剐，敢把皇帝拉下马

sentences.english: Scientists are searching for a cure to the common cold.
sentences.chinese: 壳学家仍在寻求治疗剐冒的方法。

sentences.english: Our prices are not dearer than those in other places.
sentences.chinese: 我们的价格不比剐的地方贵。

sentences.english: She tore her finger on the nail.
sentences.chinese: 她在钉子上把手指剐破了。

sentences.english: Do you know what l:'ve just heard?
sentences.chinese: 你知道我剐听说的事鸥？

sentences.english: I demand a full refund for this purchase.
sentences.chinese: 我要求呃剐交易全铪退款。
也许沉默不过剐㨁证明没有把握。

sentences.english: The girl tore a hole in her dress climbing over the wall.
sentences.chinese: 那女孩翻墙时将连衣裙剐了一个洞。

sentences.english: Want the look of a digital watch with the cachet of a classical timepiece?
sentences.chinese: 想看磕暌剐经典优异标识表记标帜的数字电子手表吗？

sentences.english: We're currently in the process of redesigning Disembowel.
sentences.chinese: 我们目前在重新设计剐肠。

definition: to make mincemeat of sb/to hack sb to pieces (used while cursing)
to scoop out/to gouge out
the lingering death/the death of a thousand cuts (old form of capital punishment)
to slaughter livestock/to govern or rule/to cheat customers/imperial official in dynastic China
death cannot wipe out the crimes (idiom); dreadful crimes that rankled even after the perpetrator is dead
to be decapitated (idiom)
It's all exaggeration, you don't need to take it seriously/a fuss about nothing/nothing to write home about
pinyin: sha1 ren2 bu4 guo4 tou2 dian3 di4

definition: to pay with one's life
suffering/hardship/living hell
to kill/to put to death
to knock down and kill sb with a car/to run over sb/to run sb down
to deal with (an offender)
to give vent to anger
A debt of blood must be paid in blood./Blood calls for blood.
knife/CL:把[ba3]
to dismember a corpse
